Locusts 
 Mary Okere 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day we saw a strange 
 
 black cloud move in from 
 
 far away. 
 
 
 
 It was a swarm of locusts, 
 
 headed for our vilage. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The locusts atacked farms 
 
 and ate the crops. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We tried to chase the 
 
 locusts away. 
 
 
 
 But they would not go. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We made noises and 
 
 screamed, “Wuwi, wuwi!” 
 
 
 
 But the locusts would not 
 
 go. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We hit tins and metal pots. 
 
 
 
 But the locusts would not 
 
 go. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We lit fires to chase the 
 
 locusts away. 
 
 
 
 But they would not go. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They setled on tres. 
 
 
 
 Branches broke because of 
 
 the weight of al the 
 
 locusts. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then we remembered that 
 
 roasted locusts are god to 
 
 eat! 
 
 
 
 Everyone started to colect 
 
 the locusts in sacks and 
 
 nets. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Children brought gourds 
 
 and filed them with 
 
 locusts. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 We roasted locusts and 
 
 fried them. 
 
 
 
 We even dried locusts for 
 
 the cold season. 
 
 
 
 But stil, there were so 
 
 many locusts. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then, the next morning, the 
 
 locusts flew away. The 
 
 cloud left our vilage. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When the farmers saw 
 
 their farms, they moaned 
 
 loudly: “Our farms are 
 
 destroyed!” 
 
 
 
 The vilagers cried, “What 
 
 wil we eat this year? What 
 
 have the locusts left us?”
